p: Three studies have further examined smoking and olfaction among PD cases [ 53â€“55], aiming to explore whether smoking protects phenotypical conversion from olfactory impairment to PD. However, analyses of smoking and olfaction conditioned on PD will create a collider issue in epidemiologic causal inference and thus might have generated spurious findings [ 56]. Taken together, the overall epidemiological data do not support a major role of cigarette smoking in olfactory impairment and data of phenotypical conversion is lacking.
